title: Bangladesh Election 2026 LIVE: Voting Closes In Bangladesh Polls
content: Bangladesh Election 2026 Voting Live Updates: Bangladeshi is voting today in a crucial national election, the first since the July 2024 uprising that ended former Prime Minister Sheikh Hasina's 15 years of iron-fisted rule.

title: 4 Days To Arrest Shivam Mishra After Lamborghini Crash, Bail Within Hours
content: Lamborghini Crash Shivam Mishra Bail: Mishra was arrested four days after the Rs 10-crore luxury car rammed an autorickshaw, a motorcycle and later crashed into a pole, leaving one person injured.

title: 'Return To India If You Want Your Case Heard': High Court To Vijay Mallya
content: Fugitive businessman Vijay Mallya must return to India if he wants his petition against a law that designated him a fugitive to be heard, the Bombay High Court said today.

title: India's Energy Shift, Defence Ties Seen As Win Against China: Top US Official
content: The US views India's gradual reduction in Russian oil imports and its deepening defence partnership with Washington as a strategic gain that strengthens the balance of power in the Indo-Pacific, a senior US official told lawmakers.

title: BJP MP Makes 1st Move In Bid To Disqualify Rahul Gandhi From Parliament
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey has initiated a formal process seeking to disqualify Congress MP Rahul Gandhi from the Lok Sabha. Dubey's move came amid acrimonious exchanges between Rahul Gandhi and BJP MPs over several controversial issues.

title: Opinion: Opinion | The JF-17 'Hype': How Pak Is Pushing A Jet That's More Noise Than Substance
content: Even if the JF-17 may seem like a popular choice for many nations, interoperability is not exportable, nor is effective warfighting capability.

title: India Okays Rs 3.25 Lakh Crore Deal To Buy 114 Rafale Fighter Jets
content: The Defence Ministry on Thursday approved the Rs 3.25 lakh crore proposal to buy 114 Rafale fighter jets from France for the Indian Air Force, according to reliable sources.

title: NDTV Exclusive: Hardeep Puri On "Exotic Island", "Have Fun" Mails To Epstein
content: Union Minister Hardeep Singh Puri, in an exclusive interview with NDTV, issued a clarification of his past interactions with the disgraced American financier and convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein.

title: Rajpal Yadav Seeks Bail, Court Says Actor Didn't Honour "Own Commitment"
content: The Delhi High Court said actor Rajpal Yadav was sent to jail in a Rs 9 crore debt case after he failed to honour commitments to resolve unpaid dues on over "two dozen occasions".

title: Opinion: Opinion | Inside India's High-Stakes Push For Buying A Record 114 Rafales
content: If the power of such a huge purchase does not put New Delhi in the driver's seat to fast-track acquisition of technology, then nothing else will.

title: Parliament Budget Session Day 12 Live Updates: BJP MP Files Notice To Terminate Rahul Gandhi's Parliament Membership
content: Parliament Budget Session LIVE Updates, Day 12: The BJP has filed a notice to terminate Congress MP Rahul Gandhi's Parliament membership, whole no privilege motion against the leader will be fined.

title: About Exile Act, Republican Bill That Can End H-1B Visa Programme In US
content: Amid President Donald Trump's anti-immigration push in the United States, a new bill has been introduced in the US Congress seeking to end the H-1B visa program.

title: Video: Bouncers Try To Remove Number Plate From Lamborghini After Crash
content: In a 36-second-long video, Mishra's bouncer is seen trying to uproot the number plate from the Italian luxury car costing over Rs 10 crore in the presence of the police.

title: "I Didn't Seek Meetings": Hardeep Puri To NDTV On "Epstein Files" Attack
content: Union minister Hardeep Singh Puri today continued his counter-attack on Rahul Gandhi over the Congress MP's "Epstein Files" comments in parliament yesterday.

title: 'Don't Leave Kerala': Court Grants Anticipatory Bail To Rape-Accused Expelled MLA
content: The Kerala High Court on Thursday granted anticipatory bail to Palakkad MLA and expelled Congress leader Rahul Mamkootathil in a rape and forced abortion case, directing him not to leave Kerala.

title: New Book Publishing Rules For Armed Forces Amid Row Over Ex Army Chief Book
content: Controversy over an unpublished memoir by former Army Chief General MM Naravane has triggered both a police investigation and a policy rethink within the Ministry of Defence, with the government now moving towards forming stricter rules

title: 'Godman' Seen Carrying Poison Laddoos Fed To 3 Found Dead In Car In Delhi
content: CCTV visuals showed 72-year-old occult practitioner Kamruddin carrying a small packet in his hand, which contained poison-laced laddoos that killed three people in Ghaziabad last week.

title: 5 Injured After Elevator Falls From 4th Floor In Mumbai's Byculla
content: At least five people were seriously injured after an elevator of an 18-storey residential building in Mumbai's Byculla area collapsed on Wednesday night.

title: Bangladesh Elections 2026: What Two-Ballot System And Blue Thumb Mark Mean
content: Bangladesh follows a parliamentary system similar to India. However, this time, each voter is being given two ballot papers.

title: Veteran Doordarshan Anchor Sarla Maheshwari Dies At The Age Of 71
content: Veteran Doordarshan anchor Sarla Maheshwari's funeral will take place today at 4 pm at Nigam Bodh Ghat in the national captial, Delhi.

title: Mavs' Flagg (foot) out for Laker game, Rising Stars
content: Mavericks rookie Cooper Flagg has a left midfoot sprain that will sideline him through All-Star Weekend, the team announced Wednesday.

title: BYU receiver Kingston charged with felony rape
content: The first-degree charge against Parker Kingston comes after a nearly yearlong investigation, the Washington County (Utah) Attorney's Office said.

title: K-State coach rips team: Don't deserve to be here
content: In a brief but tense postgame news conference, Kansas State coach Jerome Tang questioned his team's pride after a 91-62 loss to Cincinnati, saying, "These dudes do not deserve to wear this uniform."

title: KD laughs off ASG competition, jabs at Luka, Jokic
content: Kevin Durant took a playful jab at Luka Doncic, Nikola Jokic and the rest of the NBA All-Star World team when asked how hard his own U.S. squad of LeBron James and Kawhi Leonard plans to compete in the midseason showcase.

title: Porter: Roethlisberger 'not a good teammate'
content: Ex-Steelers linebacker and assistant coach Joey Porter Sr. said in a podcast last week that quarterback Ben Roethlisberger wasn't a good teammate or person.

content: Several Manchester United supporters groups condemned comments made by co-owner Sir Jim Ratcliffe after the British billionaire said the U.K. has been "colonized" by immigrants.

title: Busch, 0-for-20 in Daytona 500, captures pole
content: Kyle Busch, who is winless in 20 Daytona 500 starts and hasn't started in the top five since 2016, earned the pole Wednesday night with a lap at 183.925 mph.

content: A bus carrying the Iowa Lakes Community College baseball team crashed and rolled into a ditch Wednesday morning, killing one person and injuring the other 32 on board.

content: All right: We've covered the best deals in PL history, but what makes a bad deal? Whatever the reasons behind them, here are the 50 worst since the league began in 1992.

content: There are no surefire free agent QBs available this March, and the draft class has only one first-round lock. So what now for teams that might need a quarterback?

content: The ACC and Big 12 will have a say in the field's final teams. For now, the Last Four In all hail from the ACC.

content: Odds for all 20 teams to win their pool group and to win the World Baseball Classic, which begins March 6.

content: The Carter effect helped popularize the NBA in Canada. The Tempo hope to similarly supercharge women's basketball.

content: Garrett and Kim had a hilarious debate over which of them was more dominant in their respective sport.

content: Some conference championship rings fetch big bucks. Others wind up collecting dust on a closet shelf. Players share mixed opinions on the NFL's sparkly consolation prize.

content: It was a heartbreaking offseason for much of NASCAR, and as the garage descends on Daytona, the stock car world is ready to refocus on racing.

content: Brandon Figueroa stopped Nick Ball in round 12 to claim the WBA featherweight championship and climb in the rankings. Here are the latest ESPN divisional rankings.

content: A closer look at the players who benefited most from the moves made leading up to last week's NBA trade deadline.

title: Mega Rs 3.6L cr defence boost: Govt gives nod for 114 Rafale jets, missiles & P-8I aircraft
content: India's Defence Acquisition Council has approved the purchase of Rafale fighter jets from France for an estimated Rs 3.25 lakh crore. This significant procurement will see 80% of the jets manufactured in India, bolstering the Indian Air Force's fleet and addressing rising regional security concerns.

title: Rs 260cr settlement for family of Indian student killed by US police officer ‚Äî what is the case?
content: The family of Jaahnavi Kandula, a 23-year-old Indian student killed by a speeding police officer in Seattle, has secured a $29 million settlement. Kandula was struck and killed by an officer driving 74 mph while responding to an emergency. The incident gained further outrage after another officer was heard laughing about the crash on body camera footage.

title: Kanpur Lambo crash: Arrested after 4 days, tycoon's son gets bail within hours
content: Shivam Mishra, accused in a Kanpur Lamborghini crash that injured three, was granted bail hours after his arrest. His lawyer claimed the driver, Mohan M., was behind the wheel, but police investigations indicated Mishra was driving. Mohan's surrender application was rejected by the court.

title: 'Used for terror, fraud': Russia blocks WhatsApp for defying local laws
content: Responding separately to Russian news agency TASS, Peskov indicated that the platform could be restored if its parent company complies with local regulations. "This is a matter of compliance with Russian laws. If Meta complies, it will enter into dialogue with the Russian authorities, and then there will be an opportunity to reach an agreement," he said.

title: Unsold in IPL, Steve Smith becomes PSL's costliest signing
content: Steve Smith shattered PSL records, becoming the most expensive player at PKR 14 crore for the Sialkot Stallions. The revamped 11th edition features a new auction system and two new franchises. Naseem Shah was the top Pakistani buy, while Babar Azam was retained. The tournament runs March 26-May 3.

title: Oracle can't stop explaining 'all is well' after $300 billion 'OpenAI Shock'
content: Oracle is actively promoting its AI data center progress and job creation efforts amidst significant investor concerns. The company's massive $300 billion OpenAI cloud contract, signed in September 2025, has led to a substantial stock decline and ballooning debt. Despite upbeat updates, market jitters persist over the startup's financial stability and Oracle's deep entanglement.

title: Kim Jong Un's teenage daughter being positioned as successor, South Korea says
content: South Korea's intelligence agency believes Kim Jong Un is grooming his teenage daughter, Kim Ju Ae, as his successor, signaling a potential fourth-generation dynasty. Her increasing public appearances at key events, including military functions and a visit to a sacred mausoleum, suggest a formal designation is imminent. This marks a significant shift in North Korea's traditionally male-dominated leadership.

title: 'Voiced concern over social media addiction': 27-year-old YouTuber held for slitting father‚Äôs throat
content: A 27-year-old YouTuber allegedly murdered her father in Korba, Chhattisgarh, after a heated argument over her social media addiction and content creation. The incident, which also involved a land dispute, saw the daughter fatally attack her father with a sickle while he slept. Police have arrested the accused, with investigations ongoing.

title: India AI Impact Summit 2026: What it is, who's coming, and why it matters
content: The India AI Impact Summit 2026, scheduled for February 16-20 at Bharat Mandapam in New Delhi, is the first global AI summit hosted in the Global South. Google's Sundar Pichai, OpenAI's Sam Altman, Nvidia's Jensen Huang, and Anthropic's Dario Amodei are among the confirmed attendees. The five-day programme is built around three 'Sutras'‚ÄîPeople, Planet, Progress‚Äîand seven working groups called 'Chakras' covering AI safety, skilling, inclusion, and economic growth.

title: No World Cup for 18 years to now four in a row: How 2019 changed Namibia cricket
content: From missing World Cups for nearly two decades to qualifying for four in a row, Namibia‚Äôs rise has been built on central contracts, homegrown talent and long-term planning. After losing their opening match, Gerhard Erasmus-led side will take on defending champions India on Thursday.

title: Rammed, flung, crushed: 24-year-old woman killed after drunk Haryana cop‚Äôs car mows her down
content: A 24-year-old Gurgaon-based professional, Nikita Bajaj, was killed in Ambala Cantonment after an e-rickshaw she was travelling in was hit from behind by a car allegedly driven at high speed by a police head constable. She was run over and declared dead at hospital. The accused was detained, and allegations of intoxication are under investigation.

title: Rajpal Yadav cheque bounce case: Actor to remain in jail, next hearing on Feb 16
content: Actor Rajpal Yadav has surrendered to Tihar jail. He failed to repay debts amounting to Rs 9 crore. The court refused his bail plea, citing a family wedding. Judicial procedure must be followed. Yadav's counsel argued for bail, proposing security deposit. The matter is listed for further hearing. Bollywood celebrities are supporting Yadav and pledging financial help.

title: In a First, Elon Musk‚Äôs company posts 45-minute all-hands after co-founder exit
content: Elon Musk's xAI has unveiled significant internal shifts, including employee departures and a new four-team structure focused on Grok, coding, video generation, and a 'Macrohard' project.  The company also reported substantial revenue and impressive AI-generated content figures, alongside Musk's bold vision for space-based AI infrastructure and lunar operations.

title: Quote of the day by Lindsey Vonn: 'I‚Äôm never tired of winning'
content: Lindsey Vonn embodied resilience after a devastating Olympic crash, updating fans from hospital following her third successful surgery on a complex leg fracture. The 41-year-old, who had also ruptured her ACL days earlier, stressed that ‚Äúsuccess‚Äù now means recovery. After returning from retirement in 2024 and dominating World Cup races, Vonn‚Äôs comeback inspired fans and athletes alike. Her quote, ‚ÄúI‚Äôm never tired of winning,‚Äù reflects her relentless spirit and refusal to surrender to injury or doubt.

title: Sand Martin manager found dead in office building in Gurgaon
content: A 33-year-old manager was found dead at the base of his office building in Gurgaon's Spaze IT Park. Police are investigating the incident as a suspected suicide, with CCTV footage showing the man alone on the terrace shortly before his death. His family has been informed, and no foul play is currently suspected.

title: 'Leadership will take call whenever they find suitable': DKS amid CM tussle
content: Karnataka Deputy Chief Minister DK Shivakumar has dismissed speculation about a leadership change, stating no discussions on the chief ministerial post occurred during his meetings with Congress leaders. He emphasized the party's focus on its broader vision and goals, with senior leaders to make decisions at an opportune time.

title: Sarla Maheshwari, one of Doordarshan‚Äôs most familiar faces, dies at 71
content: Veteran Doordarshan news anchor Sarla Maheshwari, a prominent figure in 1980s Indian television journalism, passed away at 71. Known for her calm demeanor and clear diction, she was a trusted voice in Indian households for nearly three decades, defining credibility in the medium's formative years. Her passing marks the end of a significant era in television news.

title: ‚ÄòWe‚Äôll do it our way‚Äô: Frustrated Namibia questions night practice disparity with India
content: Namibia's captain, Gerhard Erasmus, expressed frustration over the T20 World Cup schedule, noting his team received no night training sessions despite facing India in a night fixture.  Erasmus highlighted the lack of floodlit practice facilities in Namibia, making the adjustment difficult for his players. Despite the disadvantage, the team is prepared to compete in their own 'Namibian way'.

title: No tariff to Indian textile: Piyush Goyal clarifies on US trade deal after B'desh pact
content: Goyal also stressed that the India-US trade deal, which reduces tariffs on Indian exports to 18%, does not touch sensitive agriculture and dairy sectors. On Saturday, India and the US had released a joint statement on the trade agreement.

title: 'Sectarian agenda': Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind chief criticises govt's mandate on Vande Mataram
content: Jamiat Ulama-i-Hind president Arshad Madani criticised the Union Government's mandate to sing all six stanzas of 'Vande Mataram' in schools and official functions. He stated the decision infringes on religious freedom and minority rights, as some verses contradict monotheistic beliefs. Madani argued the move reflects electoral politics and a sectarian agenda rather than patriotism.

title: Sarla Maheshwari, iconic DD newsreader, passes away at 71
content: Sarla Maheshwari, one of the most recognisable faces of Doordarshan‚Äôs retro era, passed away on Thursday.  Maheshwari became a household name during the 1980s and 1990s, when Doordarshan dominated the television news space in India. For nearly three decades, from 1976 until 2005, she delivered Hindi news bulletins with composure and clarity, earning admiration for her measured tone and flawless diction.

title: A winning dressing room is a smiling dressing room: Gautam Gambhir
content: Returning to his hometown Delhi for the match against Namibia, India's head coach Gautam Gambhir emphasised the importance of team togetherness in the demanding world of elite sports. He highlighted how support staff become like family, fostering a relaxed atmosphere during practice. Gambhir candidly stated that only a winning dressing room brings smiles, underscoring the pressure of professional cricket.

title: ‚ÄòBe ready for exemplary costs‚Äô: SC raps Congress MP Jairam Ramesh ‚Äî why
content: The Supreme Court sternly rebuked Congress MP Jairam Ramesh for challenging an Office Memorandum that aimed to implement the court's ruling against retrospective environmental clearances. ‚ÄúBe ready for exemplary costs. We know the design behind this,‚Äù a bench led by CJI Surya Kant said. Justices warned of hefty costs, viewing the challenge as an indirect attack on the apex court's judgment itself. Ramesh subsequently withdrew his plea.

title: Overturning family court order: Why Delhi HC allowed early mutual divorce plea
content: The parties got married on 30 March 2025, at Arya Samaj Mandir, Khirki Village, New Delhi and registered their marriage on 2 April 2025 with the office of the District Magistrate, South Delhi. It was an admitted position before the Court that the parties never cohabited even for a single day after the marriage, the marriage was never consummated, and both continued residing at their respective parental homes immediately thereafter.

title: World's most powerful passports: Indian passport at 75th spot; check top 10 list
content: At present, India is placed at the 75th position in the index. However, it still trails several countries when measured by the number of destinations that allow Indian passport holders visa-free entry or provide visa-on-arrival access.

title: How 4 women are protecting children in a village surrounded by tigers
content: In Maharashtra's Sitaram Peth village, bordering Tadoba Tiger Sanctuary, four women have taken on the dangerous task of escorting children to school. Facing constant tiger threats on a dark, unlit road, these mothers bravely patrol with sticks and torches, ensuring the children's safe passage to and from the bus stand, driven by the strength of their maternal love.

title: 'Being woke is one thing, but ... ':SC flays makers of 'Ghooskhor Pandat'; directs title change
content: The Supreme Court has ordered Netflix and the makers of the film "Ghooskhor Pandit" to change its title, deeming it denigrative of a particular community. The bench emphasized that no section of society should be disparaged, citing constitutional principles of fraternity and the need for responsible speech.

title: From ice hockey to T20 WC‚Äôs youngest talents: Ajayveer finds ‚Äògreat feeling‚Äô in Delhi
content: Ajayveer Hundal, a 20-year-old Canadian cricketer, shares his journey from ice hockey to the sport's biggest stage. Born to Indian parents, Hundal discovered his love for cricket during the 2019 World Cup. He trained in India to hone his skills. Hundal now plays in the T20 World Cup, a dream come true.

title: Why is stock market down today? Top reasons for Rs 3 lakh crore selloff
content: Stock market today: Nifty50 and BSE Sensex, the benchmark indices of the stock market, tanked in trade on Thursday, with IT stocks leading the decline. Technology stocks led the downturn, with Tech Mahindra, Infosys and Tata Consultancy Services (TCS) falling nearly 6 per cent each.

title: Road rage in Bengaluru: Man clings to car bonnet, dragged for 1km on Old Airport Road ‚Äî watch
content: In a jaw-dropping scene on Old Airport Road, a goods vehicle operator clashed with a car driver over a minor fender bender. Upset over the incident, the truck driver perched himself on the car's hood, only for the enraged car owner to speed off, dragging him for a whole kilometer before he could break free.

title: What unfolded in Lok Speaker Om Birla's chamber on Feb 4? Rijiju releases video clip
content: Union parliamentary affairs minister Kiren Rijiju released a video he said was secretly filmed by a Congress MP inside Lok Sabha Speaker Om Birla‚Äôs chamber. He alleged that 20‚Äì25 Congress MPs entered, behaved abusively and issued threats. The row comes amid escalating tensions in Parliament, with the opposition accusing Birla of partisanship and the government condemning repeated disruptions.

title: 'Linked with anti-India forces': BJP MP moves motion to revoke Rahul Gandhi's Parliament membership
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey has moved a motion in the Lok Sabha seeking termination of Rahul Gandhi's parliamentary membership and a lifetime ban from elections, accusing him of misleading the nation with "anti-India forces." The motion follows Gandhi's speech alleging the Centre compromised national interests by allowing the US to weaponize energy and financial systems.

title: ‚ÄòWe are in match zone‚Äô: Tilak Varma fires India-Pak warning ahead of T20 WC blockbuster
content: India batter Tilak Varma expressed excitement for the upcoming ICC Men's T20 World Cup clash against Pakistan on February 15, stating the team has entered "match zone" after fixture confirmation. Varma emphasised a methodical approach, focusing on one match at a time with video analysis and adapting to wicket conditions.

title: Bihar ‚Äòpakadua vivah‚Äô horror: Student kidnapped by friends, drugged, forced into marriage
content: In a shocking incident from Samastipur, a 22-year-old student named Nitish Kumar was said to have been drugged and abducted by those he considered acquaintances. For two harrowing days, he was reportedly held against his will after being sedated.

title: Canada shooting: Trans teen killed mother and step-brother before school rampage
content: A tragic mass shooting in British Columbia has claimed nine lives, including an 18-year-old suspect, Jesse Van Rootselaar, who first killed her mother and stepbrother. The shooter then opened fire at a local school before taking her own life. Authorities are investigating the motive behind the devastating incident, which has left the remote community reeling.

title: Kanpur Lamborghini crash: Days after road rampage, tobacco baron's son Shivam Mishra arrested
content: Shivam Mishra, son of tobacco baron K K Mishra, was arrested in connection with a fatal Lamborghini crash on Kanpur's VIP Road. The arrest followed the dismissal of his driver's surrender application, with the court noting Shivam was the accused. The court also directed Shivam to cooperate with the vehicle's technical examination.

title: Death of a salesman, birth of a cricketer: How Usman Tariq became Pakistan‚Äôs X-factor
content: Pakistan's mystery spinner Usman Tariq, inspired by MS Dhoni, has become a significant threat ahead of the India clash. His unique slinging action and stop-start run-up have troubled batsmen, with R Ashwin and WV Raman defending his bowling style. Indian batters, however, are expected to adapt to the challenge posed by Tariq and Pakistan's other spinners.

title: Will gold hit Rs 1.75 lakh/10 gms & silver cross Rs 3 lakh/kg soon?
content: Gold and silver price prediction: Gold and silver prices have bounced back from recent lows, and appear to be on path for a long-term rise, believes Abhilash Koikkara, Head - Forex & Commodities, Nuvama Professional Clients Group. The commodity expert shares his outlook for gold and silver in the coming sessions:

title: Bollywood extortion row: Who is Aayush Sharma, the actor targeted after Ranveer Singh?
content: Bollywood actor Aayush Sharma has reportedly received an extortion demand from the Lawrence Bishnoi gang via email, adding him to a list of industry figures targeted recently. This development is significant as Sharma is Salman Khan's brother-in-law, who has also faced threats from the same gang. Police are investigating the email's origin and have advised Sharma to remain vigilant.

title: UN report flags JeM role in Delhi Red Fort blast; warns of Masood Azhar‚Äôs women-only terror wing
content: A UN Security Council report has implicated Jaish-e-Mohammed in a car bombing near Delhi's Red Fort last November, which claimed 15 lives. The outfit's leader, Masood Azhar, reportedly established a women's wing to aid terror attacks. Investigations into the incident revealed a 'white-collar' terror module, leading to several arrests.

title: Online shopping fraud: Karnataka Upalokayukta gets old clothes parcel instead of razor blade
content: The delivery agent reportedly denied responsibility and advised Justice K.N. Phaneendra to contact the online shopping company, stating that the logistics firm was not connected to the contents of the parcel.

title: Watch: BJP moves substantive motion against Rahul Gandhi, Nishikant Dubey seeks life-long ban
content: BJP MP Nishikant Dubey has moved a substantive motion in the Lok Sabha against Leader of Opposition Rahul Gandhi, accusing him of misleading the country. A substantive motion is an independent, self-contained proposal submitted for the approval of a legislative house or assembly, drafted to express a decision or opinion.

title: Home Ministry‚Äôs order on National Song does not reflect spirit of Constitution: CPI(M)
content: The BJP-led Union government is attempting to create an unnecessary controversy concerning the National Song and the National Anthem with ulterior motives, says the CPI(M) Politburo in a statement

title: LDF, UDF differ over effectiveness of general strikes as a modern political tool
content: Govindan accuses Congress of reining in INTUC from taking part in strike; Satheesan says general strikes turned into crippling bandhs in Kerala, while they had no impact on other States; Tharoor says right to protest should not degenerate into right to disrupt; Elamaram Kareem highlights the contemporary relevance of strike

title: T.N. Assembly poll: MDMK will seek seats that will ensure Election Commission recognition, says Durai Vaiko
content: On whether the MDMK would seek sharing of power, he said that there would be no need for a coalition Government in the State and the DMK would form the next government on its own.

title: Building data centres in India far cheaper than in U.S., drawing global hyperscalers: Raju Vegesna
content: When it came to building data centres, India was globally one of the most cost-effective in terms of cost per mega watt, Mr. Vegesna said, during a fireside chat with John Xavier, Tech Editor, The Hindu, as part of The Hindu Tech Summit 2026

title: Daily UPI transactions set to touch  ‚Çπ100 crore shortly, says RBI official
content: Nearly 85% of digital transactions in India are conducted through UPI, says V.S. Prajish, General Manager, RBI

title: T.N. CM Stalin inaugurates railway overbridge on¬†Korukkupet-Manali Road
content: Mr. Stalin also unveiled¬†the foundation for the construction of a park near Korukkupet-Manali Road at a cost of¬†‚Çπ1.10 crore

title: T.N. Assembly election: Premallatha denies simultaneous alliance negotiations with DMK, AIADMK
content: While responding to a query on share in power, she said such an arrangement could be decided only after the declaration of the election results.

title: TVK leader Vijay to address party functionaries in Salem on February 13
content: On Friday, Mr. Vijay is scheduled to address his party functionaries belonging to five districts namely Salem, Namakkal, Erode, Dharmapuri and Krishnagiri between 12 p.m. and 3 p.m.

title: Resilience must be built into everyday operations of companies, say experts
content: They were taking part in a panel discussion on ‚ÄúResilience by Design: Embedding Continuity into Organisational DNA using ISO 22301 and ISO 27031‚Äù at The Hindu Tech Summit 2026 on Thursday (February 12, 2026).

title: Kerala govt suspends firearms licence restrictions for wild boar culling
content: Forest Minister orders review of contentious directive that barred persons holding arms licences for sports or institutional purposes from engaging in wild boar culling

title: New rootstocks promise faster, higher apple yields for Kashmir farms
content: Despite having one of the largest areas under apple cultivation in India, productivity in the Kashmir Valley remains far below that of developed apple-growing regions

title: Tarn Taran law student who shot dead female classmate dies
content: Prince Raj, 20, died on February 11 night at Guru Nanak Dev Hospital in Amritsar, Deputy Superintendent of Police Jagdeep Singh said

title: Defence Acquisition Council clears proposal to buy 114 Rafale fighter jets
content: The proposal paves the way for ‚Å†commercial and technical details of the deal to be discussed between ‚Äåthe two countries, after a visit by French President Emmanuel Macron ‚Äãto India

title: Sabarimala gold loss case: Former TDB Thiruvabharanam Commissioner gets statutory bail in one case
content: But K.S. Baiju will remain in jail as he is also the seventh accused in another case related to loss of gold from Dwarapalaka plates in which he is not yet eligible for statutory bail

title: Sarla Maheshwari, former Doordarshan news reader, passes away at 71
content: Maheshwari, who served as a news reader on Doordarshan from 1976 to 2005, was among the pioneers of TV news in India at a time broadcast was limited to a few hours throughout the day

title: Anbumani urges T.N. government to meet demands of guest lecturers
content: Their demands include a hike in monthly salary as recommended by the University Grants Commission (UGC) and an increase in retirement benefits up to ‚Çπ25 lakh.

title: India to receive same garment benefits as Bangladesh under U.S. trade pact: Goyal
content: The United States will reduce reciprocal tariffs on Bangladeshi goods to 19%, but garments attract zero duty only if made with U.S. cotton and man-made fibres

title: Centre ignored voices of workers, farmers while making decisions concerning their future: Rahul
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge said all the country's trade unions, farmers, and workers are on the streets against the Modi government's trade deal, labour laws and the "snatching away of MGNREGA".

title: Excelsoft Tech chief Sudhanva Dhananjaya will address TiE Mysuru session on ‚ÄòFrom Pitch to Investment‚Äô on February 21
content: Will host a session on ‚ÄòFrom Pitch to Investment‚Äô featuring Excelsoft Technologies Limited Chairman Sudhanva Dhananjaya

title: Personalised learning through AI is the future: VIT Vice-President Sekar Viswanathan
content: Noting that VIT has been adopting innovative AI-based tools and systems to enhance the overall learning experience for students, Mr. Viswanathan said faculty also need to be updated with technology

title: General strike on new labour codes: Protests in Hubballi and Dharwad
content: CITU State Secretary Mahesh Pattar said that, if unopposed, the new laws would would remove the right to form a union, remove minimum wages, and remove the right to negotiate

title: Arvind Kejriwal withdraws in HC plea against ED summonses in excise policy case
content: AAP leader Arvind Kejriwal‚Äôs decision to withdraw comes after a trial court acquitted him of charges related to non-compliance with ED summonses, while the agency prepares to appeal the ruling

title: Drug-free Mysuru initiative launched, police release WhatsApp helpline number 8277948080
content: Police officials are visiting schools and colleges in Mysuru to create awareness about the harmful effects of the drug menace

title: Court restrains Gogoi and others from making ‚Äòdefamatory statements‚Äô against CM Sarma
content: Judge Nayanjyoti Sarma stated that the court is of the opinion that if an order of 'ad-interim injunction' is not passed, it will "defeat the justice and there is every possibility of multiplicity of proceedings‚Äù

title: Supreme Court refuses to entertain plea against puja at Ladle Mashak Dargah on Mahashivaratri
content: A Bench of Justices Dipankar Datta and Satish Chandra Sharma said Article 32 of the Constitution cannot be invoked by the petitioner when the issue is pending in the Karnataka High Court

title: Higher education holds key to reducing inequality, powering economy forward: VIT Chancellor G. Viswanathan
content: At the inaugural session of The Hindu Tech Summit 2026, jointly organised by The Hindu Group, VIT, and Sify Technologies, Dr. Viswanathan said as India‚Äôs economy grew, inequality also widened

title: Consultative meet of Badanavalu Satyagrahis in Mysuru on February 14 to highlight demand to strengthen rural economy
content: The core demand of the satyagrahis ‚Äî that the country‚Äôs economy should be built on a strong foundation of rural economy ‚Äî remains unfulfilled

title: Joint parliamentary panel gets time till Monsoon Session to submit report on Bill to replace UGC
content: Soon after moving that the Bill be examined by a Joint Committee, officials had said the government was expecting the report of the panel by the end of the 2026 Budget Session

title: Kerala Police to intensify ‚ÄòD-Dad‚Äô drive to tackle digital addiction among children
content: D-Dad, or Digital De-Addition, project focuses on curbing mobile phone and internet addiction among children through counselling and professional support

title: Will not hear plea against fugitive tag if Vijay Mallya does not return to India, warns Bombay HC
content: A bench of Chief Justice Shree Chandrashekhar and Justice Gautam Ankhad said Mallya will have to first clarify whether or not he will return to India

title: Gang rape at Thiruvalla spa not linked to any quotation, say Kerala Police
content: Earlier, the spa owner had alleged that the assault was related to a quotation issued by a competitor.

title: Prohibitory orders imposed around counting centres in Malkajgiri and Cyberabad
content: Assembly of five or more persons will be prohibited at counting centres in Malkajgiri and Cyberabad from around 5 am in February 13 until vote counting is completed

title: Forest fire rages unchecked in Konnakkad-Kommadi area of Kerala‚Äôs Kasaragod; efforts on to protect habitations
content: Firefighting hampered by hilly terrain, which prevents fire tenders from accessing the core affected area directly

title: Congress MP Jairam Ramesh withdraws plea on retrospective environmental clearances
content: Bench headed by the Chief Justice of India Surya Kant asks why Jairam Ramesh sought to file a writ petition to virtually review a November 2025 majority judgment

title: Dhoni to pay ‚Çπ10 lakh for transcribing, translating documents in his defamation suit at Madras High Court
content: The High Court‚Äôs interpreter section had found that the transcription and translation of the contents of compact discs was a humongous task that may take three to four months to complete

title: You can't denigrate section of society by such title: Supreme Court raps Neeraj Pandey on 'Ghooskhor Pandat'
content: Why should you denigrate a section of society by using such a title. This is against morality and public order. We will not allow you to release the film unless you tell us the changed title, the Supreme Court Bench observed.

title: From behind bars to books: novel initiative to train Cuddalore prison inmates as writers
content: The initiative offers training to prison inmates on writing books, helping transform their thoughts into the written word. In its first phase, 101 inmates, who have expressed interest, have been chosen to be developed as writers.

title: Attempts being made to oust me from politics using false narratives: PMK founder S. Ramadoss
content: Mr. Ramadoss said talks were under way regarding the formation of an alliance for the upcoming Assembly elections and that a decision would be announced soon

title: ‚Çπ7.11 crore ATM van robbery case: Bengaluru police file chargesheet against nine accused
content: After an extensive probe lasting three months, the Investigating Officer has submitted the final report to the 56th ACMM CCH Court

title: General strike in Bengaluru: Workers protesting around Town Hall arrested, taken away from spot
content: The workers who demanded repeal of the labour codes, were detained, arrested and removed from the spot by the police

title: ‚ÄòDid not abuse anyone,‚Äô says Priyanka Gandhi, rejects Rijiju's charge of instigating MPs
content: Priyanka Gandhi targeted the government over the India-U.S. trade deal, alleging that it would adversely impact farmers

title: Bharat bandh: Trade union strike paralyses life in Kannur, Kasaragod districts of Kerala
content: In Kannur, trade unions organised a protest march to the railway station. In Kasaragod, the strike was total, with transport and trade coming to a standstill

title: Bharat Bandh sparks protests in parts of Andhra Pradesh
content: The protestors started at the Ratham Centre in the commercial area of One Town and held a massive rally, holding placards and raising slogans against the ruling party.

title: SIR by ECI is clandestine attempt by BJP to prepare National Register of Citizens, claims activist Shiv Sundar
content: He claimed that ECI was issuing notices to voters to prove their citizenship based on ‚Äòflimsy reasons‚Äô, and demanding documents, like passport and government employment certificates, that are hard to get for poor people

title: UDF pledges to enhance Kerala‚Äôs health budget and provide universal coverage if elected
content: Expressing concern over high out-of-pocket expenditure on health in Kerala, Opposition Leader V.D. Satheesan promises to bring it down to ‚Äòaffordable level‚Äô

title: Telangana CM invites Defence Minister to Gandhi Sarovar foundation-laying ceremony in late February
content: Mahatma Gandhi‚Äôs ashes were immersed at the point of confluence of Esa and Musi Rivers, in February of 1948, where the programme would be organised, informed the CM.

title: Madras High Court clears decks for elections to Tamil Film Producers Council
content: Justice P. Dhanabal dismisses applications filed against the election scheduled to be held on February 22, 2026

title: BJP‚Äôs Nishikant Dubey files notice to cancel Rahul Gandhi‚Äôs Lok Sabha membership
content: The BJP MP demanded that the ‚ÄúLok Sabha membership of Gandhi be cancelled and he be debarred from contesting elections for life‚Äù

title: Ahead of TVK chief Vijay‚Äôs visit, a look at Salem district‚Äôs voting pattern
content: Traditionally known to be a stronghold of the AIADMK, Salem¬†favoured¬†the party¬†in 10 out of its¬†11 Assembly constituencies,¬†both in the 2016 and 2021 Assembly elections ‚Äì the outlier being Salem (North)

title: Kiren Rijiju reiterates claim of Congress MPs abusing Lok Sabha speaker Om Birla
content: Parliamentary Affairs Minister Kiren Rijiju shared what he described as an "illegal video" recorded by a Congress MP

title: AAP MP Sanjay Singh gives zero-hour notice in Rajya Sabha on demand for strong road safety laws
content: In his notice to the Upper House, AAP MP Sanjay Singh cited the alarming rise in accidents and fatalities nationwide and stressed that citizens are paying the price for negligence in infrastructure and governance

title: Woman dies after car driven by Haryana cop runs her over
content: Some eyewitnesses alleged that the head constable was in an inebriated condition at the time of the incident

title: Assam BJP social media co-convenor removed for uploading controversial video
content: The video showed Mr. Sarma purportedly taking aim with a rifle and firing a shot at two people, one wearing a skull cap and the other with a beard, with "point-blank shot" as the caption

title: Kerala HC grants anticipatory bail to MLA Rahul Mamkootathil in first rape case
content: Bail granted on condition that MLA will appear before investigating officer on February 16 for interrogation and surrender his mobile phone

title: Protest in Visakhapatnam against central government‚Äôs anti-labour policies
content: The protesters came up with certain demands including regularisation of all contract, outsourcing, and unorganised sector workers. Workers should be paid a minimum wage of ‚Çπ26,000 along with ESI, PF, and Gratuity benefits

title: Ayurvod, the herbal liqueur from Poland, blends Ayurvedic flavours with Polish vodka
content: Ayurvod by Midhun Mohan contains around 75 ingredients, including spices such as clove, cinnamon, cardamom, among others. It recently won a gold medal at the 2025 Warsaw Spirits Competition in the herbal liqueur category

title: ED summons former Punjab CM Amarinder Singh, son in FEMA case
content: The father-son duo have been accused of being the "beneficiaries" of certain foreign assets, including a Swiss bank account

title: Bharat Bandh: Trade union strike disrupts normal life in Kerala; transport services hit
content: Public services and businesses disrupted. With transport services halted, people face significant challenges as the strike unfolded

title: Bharat Bandh LIVE: Congress backs nationwide strike; Rahul Gandhi, Kharge attack Centre over trade deal and labour laws
content: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge said all the country's trade unions, farmers, and workers are on the streets against the Modi government's trade deal, labour laws and the "snatching away of MGNREGA".

title: Luxury car crash case: Shivam Mishra gets bail from Kanpur court
content: The luxury car rammed into pedestrians and vehicles in the upscale Gwaltoli area around 3 p.m. on February 8, 2026

title: Strike: Banking may be hit; transport and schools to function as usual
content: The strike, called by central trade unions and supported by organisations representing agricultural, rural, and informal sector workers, is expected to witness participation across sectors in several States

title: Four-member DGCA team visits Ajit Pawar plane crash site in Baramati
content: During their visit, they reviewed the CCTV camera footage and videos linked to the January 28 incident, said local officials.

title: Have States gained from the 16th FC? | Explained
content: What have been the recommendations of the 16th Finance Commission? What taxes are shared between the Centre and the States? Why did the last Commission revise vertical devolution to 41%? What had industrialised States such as Maharashtra, Gujarat, Tamil Nadu, Karnataka and Telangana demanded?

title: Bombay HC reduces life term of rape convict to 12 years, cites his age at time of crime, essay on Gandhiji
content: The Bench also considered certificates showing his participation in prison educational activities, including an essay competition and a programme studying the thoughts of Mahatma Gandhi

title: Union Minister Shivraj Singh Chauhan attends Janpratinidhi Sammelan in Agartala
content: The event saw inauguration of various rural development projects and beneficiary felicitation programmes

title: PM Narendra Modi‚Äôs foreign visits cost ‚Çπ462 crores in 2021-25
content: Travel to the U.S. accounts for 16% of total foreign visit expenditure in the period; Japan and France follow at nearly 9% each

title: Villagers skip meeting convened by Odisha govt over Anganwadi boycott row
content: For past three months, villagers have stopped sending their children to Anganwadi Centre where Dalit woman was appointed as helper-cum-cook

title: Construction of ‚ÄòBabri Masjid‚Äô begins at Murshidabad
content: Bharatpur MLA Humyaun Kabir had laid the foundation stone for a mosque, modelled on Ayodhya‚Äôs Babri Masjid, on December 6, 2025.

title: Antimicrobial resistance: Charles Darwin was right; India‚Äôs drug policy isn‚Äôt
content: Antibiotics aren‚Äôt only pharmacological agents: they are evolutionary interventions that reshape microbial populations wherever they are deployed

title: Delhi High Court asks Centre to respond to plea on ‚Äòsurge‚Äô in missing person cases
content: The petition, filed by an NGO, states that there is an ‚Äúunprecedented crisis‚Äù in Delhi, with reports of more than 800 persons going missing in the first 15 days of this year

title: Anna University inaugurates state-of-the-art AI lab
content: Housed at the Technology Research Park at the University, the lab will serve as a hub for research projects, internships, workshops, hackathons, and industry-driven certification programmes

title: U.P. budget 2026: BJP‚Äôs farewell budget, lacks focus, says Opposition
content: Samajwadi Party president Akhilesh Yadav alleged that the government has not been able to spend even 50% of the previous budget so far; Congress demands white paper on project and proposal implementation

title: West Bengal BJP welcomes MHA directive of singing all stanzas of Vande Mataram
content: State BJP president Samik Bhattacharya said that it is most unfortunate if someone smells communalism in Goddess Durga

title: Protest against Ken-Betwa river link project turns violent in M.P.; 3 cases lodged
content: Locals from various villages were protesting for various demands, including the release of AAP leader Amit Bhatnagar and better compensation and rehabilitation for those affected by the project, says police

title: Haryana citizens send 11,000 suggestions to govt.‚Äôs AI-based portal for State budget
content: Suggestions concerning local self-governance or municipalities and panchayats topped the list at 750, followed by 450 on infrastructure development, and 200 on education, skill development, and employment

title: Salman Khan‚Äôs brother-in-law Aayush Sharma gets threat email
content: The sender of the email to Aayush Sharma, who is also an actor, claimed he was a member of the Lawrence Bishnoi gang, they said, without providing further details

title: KMRL gets nod to seek ‚Çπ1016-cr. loan for Kochi metro phase-2
content: Asian Infrastructure Investment Bank to offer assistance for the project; second phase will be completed in a time-bound manner, says Minister

title: Silk saree production hit in Kancheepuram
content: Since weavers did not get zari, they were unable to weave silk sarees and have not gotten their wages for over two months now

title: Kadalukku Oru Kaditham: when the sea waits for letters
content: The Directorate of Public Libraries has set up an ocean station for marine awareness; members of the public can post letters anonymously, expressing their feelings, in an effort create a connection with nature

title: Karnataka Revenue Department makes plea to High Court
content: The Revenue Department has made a proposal to the Karnataka High Court, urging it to take up auto entry of court orders in RTCs on the lines of revenue courts

title: Karnataka High Court defers cross-examination of witnesses in murder case to prevent exposure of defence strategy
content: In a ruling reinforcing fair trial rights of the accused persons in criminal cases, the Karnataka High Court has directed a trial court to defer cross-examination of a prime witness in a murder case till the examination of remaining witnesses ‚Äòto prevent exposure of the defence strategy that may enable other witnesses to tailor their testimony‚Äô

title: Fast break: Pair of Kings worth stashing before All-Star break
content: the Detroit Pistons outlasted the Charlotte Hornets in a game defined by chaos and controversy . Isaiah Stewart 's eighth career' penned the latest entry to his r√©sum√©, tying Russell Westbrook for the most home triple-doubles in league history . the Thunder exposed the Los Angeles Lakers' inconsistency when they are without Luka Doncic .

title: Baseball is back! The stars, teams and themes we can't wait to see
content: the new york Mets capped an offseason overhaul with a trade for ace Freddy Peralta . the defending champion los Angeles Dodgers made the biggest splash when they inked no. 1 free agent Kyle Tucker to a four-year, $240 million deal .

title: Liverpool summon grit, resolve that could carry them to Champions League places
content: liverpool beat sunderland 1-0 at the stadium of light on saturday . the hosts looked set to extend their impressive home record . Virgil van Dijk rising highest to nod home what would be the winning goal .

title: What we're most excited to see in 2026: Games, players and more
content: the big Ten has regained its place as the top conference in college football after winning three consecutive national championships . the 2025 college football season culminated with a thrilling College Football Playoff and a national title for undefeated Indiana . it's hard not to look forward to the fall to see what college football does for an encore .

title: Tottenham job proved too big for Frank, but changing manager won't fix mess
content: Thomas Frank left the Kerry Hotel to take in the views of Victoria Harbour . he made it back to the hotel where club officials used it as an example of the step up he had made to Spurs . who are the candidates to replace Frank as Tottenham coach?

title: Reunions, new faces and promotions: Tracking the Power 4 coordinator moves
content: college football's coordinator carousel is often about the next big thing, the name you don't know yet but will soon enough . Chad Morris is back as offensive coordinator at Clemson . he helped engineer the program's rise alongside Dabo Swinney from 2011 to 2014 .

title: Welcome to the offseason: What you need to know about key dates, biggest questions
content: a third of the NFL could be seeking a new quarterback this offseason . the 2026 draft is projected to be particularly light at the position, and no stars are looming in free agency . teams can begin u.s. games in the coming weeks .

title: Men's Bubble Watch: Virginia Tech gets biggest victory yet with Clemson upset
content: the 2026 men's NCAA tournament is rapidly approaching . we'll use a variety of metrics as guides, classifying teams based on how likely they are to make the field of 68 as one of the 37 at-large selections . the selection committee will evaluate a team's underlying potential .
